comment: I took Mr. Westlund last semester for discrete math, so I figured I'd take him again for calculus II. His lectures are very engaging even when the material at points is insanely boring. He uses "plicker cards" (for no grade) and it's pretty fun. He's kind of weird about people asking him questions but I think that's just his personality. 7-8/10.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment:
Offers ample bonus points and retakes. Makes lectures fun with technology (working with the people around you to answer impromptu survey questions, it's a nice distraction and more helpful than you'd think). 

This is a good class to take if you want something easy, and fair, but will still ensure you to learn what you need to succeed in your major
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: Mr. Westlund, was a mixed bag, I personally liked him. He seems like an incredibly smart and passionate professor that makes you work for your grades. He can seem kind of strange in a way where it seems like he hates people asking questions but I think that's just his personality type. Took him for discrete math, Got a high C. Really smart guy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Calculus itself is hard enough. This is my 2nd attempt taking calc & I did much worse. Personally, feel like Sunny Kang was wayyy easier & straight forward. Dr.Westlund however expects you to not only know how to do the work but actually understand it & be able to put it into words. 4 exams, weekly HW (gives partial credit) Study guides not helpful
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: A quiz every single week (on Thursdays)  over things we learned the week prior. The only weeks we don't have a quiz is the weeks we have a test. Lots of homework due every Sunday night. I felt like what we learned in class was just the surface of what was on the tests. Concept heavy. All quizzes and tests in class on paper not multiple choice.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Professor Westlund is a great professor for an unforgiving class. This was my second time taking Discrete Mathematics and it went a lot smoother thanks to him. His genuine care for the subject and students are a breath of fresh air after dealing with a good amount of unmotivated professors. Get ready to spend some time doing homework.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: The class is general isnt easy but I thought Dr. Westlund was a really good professor. He's straightforward and cracks some jokes every now and then and he is definitely very passionate about his class. Also he is super good at responding to emails. Only thing Id warn is that he definitely expects you to know prerequisite math so study up.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: The material is difficult and he goes through it quickly, which led to my downfall. I had a two-day-a-week class that met for 100 minutes, which is way too long, so don't do it. There's a quiz every week and two (lengthy) homework assignments due every Sunday. Some of my classmates and I thought he wasn't very helpful with clarification questions.
rating_tags: Lots of homework

comment: he's a really good professor and you can tell he's passionate about math. Very punctual and thoroughly explains stuff.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Westlund is by far the best math professor I have ever had. When he teaches, you can tell it is something he is passionate about, which makes the class worth taking. He is more than happy to answer questions and help you out when you need. He has open office hours every week and also records the lectures to view later.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: Be prepared to read and learn on your own and not just from the slides but also from the book. He does not respond to emails from my experience and others. It is mainly a self-study class, with busy work on the side. There are no answers to the practice questions so the only way to contact him is in class or during office hours if he's there.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Calc II is no walk in the park, but Dr. Westlund does his best to effectively explain new concepts in his lectures. The homework helps with his weekly quizzes and exams. He is a bit tougher on grading, so make sure you're precise with explanations and answers. Open to meeting and helping students.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Great choice for discrete if you actually want to get a well rounded understanding of the course. The only graded portions are weekly quizzes, tests, and a 'glossary journal' which is just a collection of terminology with 3 grading checkpoints. The math is abstract so prepare to read textbook or you won't understand. Tests aren't super complex.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Definitely, the better option if the other teacher is William G. He's a good professor and really tries to help you. He helped me outside of his office hours too. This course is difficult anyway so expect some difficulty. I strongly advise him for discrete math.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Took him for calc 1 over the summer and he's a pretty good professor! Writes out and explains calculations in an effective manner and he's very understanding as well. He truly cares for the success of his students. There's a lot of homework, but in the end it helps in being prepared for the exams.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Westlund is the best teacher I might have ever got for a math class. There is a lot of homework to do, but it's pretty easy and the professor is ready to help when needed. The only thing where one should focus while taking his class is you need good amount of speed while solving the questions in the test or you will not finish it.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Amazing lectures--Tough grader

comment: Great Professor! This is just a hard course, but if you put enough time aside to study incrementally, it's not too bad. Westlund is very passionate about this area of study, and I was able to enjoy long summer lectures without losing my mind. Tests were reasonable. Doing the textbook homework and keeping up with the lecture kept me on track.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He knows what he teaches well. Very hard course
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hes a very caring and responsive teacher. Hes good about answering everybodys questions (once you reach out to him). However, even putting in a lot of work, the assessments were somewhat disappointing. Hes not strict. Hes just a by the book, math nerd which can be good and boring at the same time. The lowest test grade gets replaced by final.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: If you're taking this prof for discrete math, I suggest going with a different prof. Discrete math is a hard class and he doesn't do anything to help you really. I've heard other 2345 profs allow you to correct test answers or curve exams heavily. The highest curve we got this semester was 3 points on 1 exam and the average was still an F.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: He is a nice guy, but can be a pretty harsh grader at times. Smart guy though and is organized and knows what he is talking about.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Erik Westlund is a nice guy but not a good calc professor. The class the year before me said that 75% of his class failed and that Erik had to go to reteaching to be a professor. The calc class next to his has every test online and hw is 40% of the grade. Professor Westlund just makes his class difficult for no reason. I would not take him again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Westlund was a great professor, his class is just difficult. There were "pop quizzes" every Friday and I missed some of them. The final exam will replace your lowest midterm exam if it helps. He's a great guy and he'll crack a joke every once in a while. He doesn't explain the material that well, but going to office hours will help.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: I had Erik last semester (Spring 2019) for Discrete Math. It is a tough class, however he's pretty funny and made class enjoyable. We did group work to help better understand the concepts taught, and he posts the slides so you can review. The homework is also helpful for exams. If you're not into math, you may prefer to take Discrete Structures.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: All he talks about is graphs that aren't on his exams, he just likes to talk about them because he is doing a research project on them. He also doesn't help you if you don't understand algebra and will passively belittle you if you don't understand what he is talking about.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I've already taken calculus (in high school) so this class was a breeze. If you show up to class and go to office hours, you will be fine. If you have a question, ask it. No question is stupid.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Discrete math is just a difficult course in general but Westlund made it super fun. He made proofs a whole lot understandable than my last professor and is overall a great guy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Erik seems to really care about his students and their grades, but his grading system is killer. He explains the topics well but it's very difficult to succeed when homework is given out a week before it's due and you have pop quizzes almost every week. I've been seeing a tutor but I'm pretty sure I'll have to take this class again
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: I came into this class with previous experience in calculus from AP Calc AB, but I did not do well because of his grading system. It is pass or fail of an 85%. I usually average around an 80% on quizzes or test, but because it wasn't an 85% I always received 0's in the grade book. If you have never seen calculus before, do not take his class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: Hes very good at explaining calculus but hes one of the worst graders Ive ever seen and makes it close to impossible to do well. He grades on a mastery scale, you need to master topics to pass. At least an 80% on a quiz is mastery, he grades so hard you rarely will get mastery. He has crazy expectations and is very anal. I would not recommend!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LECTURE HEAVY--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Slow grader. The weird grading system might sound nice at first but dont be fooled. I received a C in this class but tutored all of my friends who got As in their calculus courses and it is solely because of the grading and test structure of Westlunds class. Tests are WAY harder than hw or PowerPoint practice problems.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I would not recommend taking a class taught by Erik Westlund ever. The homework he assigns are extraordinarily difficult and his exams are even harder. Save yourself, dont take him. He went from undergrad to PhD to teaching, so no real world work experience. Doesnt understand life outside of college. Prepare to spend 8+ hours on homework! AVOID!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Grading system makes it harder to get a good grade. You either know it and it's easy, or you can't fake it so you get a C or fail. He's a cool guy but that grading system made me not want to take the class again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: grading system is very flawed. takes a while to get used to it. hard grader but he does try to help.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Westlund is amazing!!!! His grading system takes some getting used to, but he really wants students to have a good foundation of Calculus. His worksheets are very similar to the tests, if you do them, you are very likely to earn mastery. Lots of studying is required, but there is minimal homework.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Westlund has a VERY different grading system, but surprisingly it works to your advantage. You can keep working to master topics in Calculus over the entire semester so there is a lot of wiggle room throughout the year to succeed. Studied hard and worked with the system to get an A. Make sure to read the syllabus and REASSESS IN OFFICE!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: The lectures were pretty simple. I found the material relatively easy. However, his "tests" are stressful and so is his grading system. To be honest, I don't recommend taking this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I was so anxious about taking calculus, because everyone talks about how hard it is. It's tough, but Dr. Westlund made it interesting, accessible, and enjoyable. His lectures are clear and he's eager to answer questions. I felt like he really cared about all of his students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: The new grading system is a little strange, but he does a good job of explaining it. He's very helpful and he'll work with you if you need him to.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took Dr. Westlund for discrete math, and I had a great experience in his class. He really knows his stuff, and is willing to work with students to make sure they understand the material. There is a large focus on homework in the class; however, that cushions your grade on the four tests. He also allows you to revise your homework assignments.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Would take again

comment: Erik very much cares about you and how you do in his class. Calc 1 was hard as hell but he is there with you for it. Take the time and go to his office hours and ask him the best way to go at the check points. You can pass if you really try.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: Erik has revitalized Calc 1 to diminish the DFW percentage. While the grading criteria is not immediately clear, if you ask or actually take time to understand you can be very successful in his class. Definitely take time to talk with him about the grade you want and which LTs you should focus on. He is also very caring and understanding.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Would take again

comment: The grading system is terrible and makes it incredibly difficult to pass let alone get a B or an A
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: Dr. Westlund is a great guy, and he clearly knows the content extremely well. My online major problem with him is that he gives one or two (sometimes none) simple examples during lecture, and then expects us to complete problems on homework and exams that are ridiculously harder than what we were taught. Very tough grader.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Take him! He explains material very well! You have to keep up with the work and go to class everyday. A LOT of homework. Each section took me at least an hour and a half.  3 tests (15% each), final(25%), hwk(15%), quizzes(15%). Lowest test grade replaced with final if it is higher. Lowest 2 quizzes dropped. Attendance bonus quizzes!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Westlund's class lectures quickly because there is so much content, but be sure to ask for help if needed (he is helpful when you ask). He posts Powerpoints and previous tests online that help when studying.  Be prepared to study for quizzes and test! He gives extra credit for attendance, and drops the lowest 2 quizzes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: You should prepare when he tells you a quiz is coming up. He drops your two lowest quiz grades. He posts all his lecture powerpoints online as well as past tests for study guides. He gives extra credit if you show up. The course is fast paced and if you don't study you will fall behind. He helps you and make sure to do all the homework!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Westlund is very clear with his lectures. Easy to follow. The homeworks became harder at the end of the course but they will help you to do well on the tests. The quizzes are easy and the two lowest are dropped. Tests are harder especially because the class was only 50 minutes long and there is proof writing which takes a while.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: HORRIBLE. DO NOT TAKE!!! He teaches all this bs and then tests on everything he did not teach! The textbook was terrible, and it explained things horribly. I love math, and received a D because of his tests and final. I even went to his office hours once or twice a week and he barely helped then.

Dr. Westlund's Discrete class was great. It was very challenging and I struggled to pass, but I really enjoyed the subject.   His lectures are interesting. The homework is difficult. The tests are more difficult. The final exam is more conceptual than practical, which helps at the end.   I'd highly recommend him but be prepared to work.

DO NOT TAKE! He will give you your text, first few weeks will be basic logic after dropadd finishes HELL. He will do 1 basic problem and expect you to do something completely different and 100x harder on your homework. On tests you will see things you have never seen before! Does help if you go to his office after class.

This professor is great, however, you will work hard. Try to really break down his notes and you will probably pass. He is very intelligent and knowledgeable, and you will learn a lot from him. I took him fall 2014.
Incredibly interesting class but very difficult. Studying is a must.

If you want to learn Discrete Math, take this guy. If you want an easy A, don't take this guy. Very reasonable and lenient in grading though, Gives partial credit on a lot of questions. I would take this professor again because he challenges you yet isn't too unreasonable. I feel like I walked out with a good understanding of Discrete Math )

Overall, he seems like a nice guy outside of class but like everyone else has said, be PREPARED TO FIGHT FOR YOUR CD! He doesn't curve exams & doesn't provide solutions for so-called "study guides". In lectures, he goes over the easier problems and tests you on the more challenging problems. The average grade in this class is a D. Need I say more?
Effective professor. I like him because he makes you work for your grade. There is nothing easy about him. He is also always available. You can reach him by email and he will respond.

Dr. Westlund is a very good professor. You really have to dig in your heals with him. His office is always open. Mathematics is clearly doctor Westlund's passion and you can see it in his lectures.   Be prepared to work. doctor Westlund is willing to help you understand the material. He does not hide from his students.

IMHO, Dr. Westlund teaches his courses how they were supposed to be taught at the first place, in terms of math. You'll see formal definitions of concepts, proofs, and applications later. This is university math, 3000 level; not high-school math. If you care about formal math, take his classes. However, you have to study hard.

Discrete Math is simple to grasp, but Westlund makes it 100x harder. There are 4 exams and 5 hw and no amounts of studying seems to help. However, read the book over and over and over and just strive for the minimum just to get out the class. You'll learn but it'll be hell on your sanity. Take Watson if you can, if not, be ready to fight for that C

Do you value your sanity? Want to avoid depression? Actually learn rather than have the material be thrown at you as if you have some PHD-level of knowledge dealing with Discrete math? If so, avoid this guy. Life was amazing until Westlund attacked. The tests are extremely hard. Like no amount of studying helps. HW the same. Just don't take him.

His teaching is fine, he uses his own notes.This class requires a lot studying and practice, more than any other math classes.His homework and tests are EXTREMELY and UNNECESSARILY hard.Never finished any of his tests. Although he loves math and loves to teach, he kind of assumes we all have a background experience with the course.Grading sucks!!
Best math teacher I've ever had. Extremely passionate about math and relays the information in a clear way. This teacher is inspiring.

Dr. Westlund is good math teacher. He explains the topics well and works a lot of problems in class. Tests are hard but he would mention you on things such simple questions. Also, he is Very intelligent and really helpful with whatever questions you have. Put your cell phone away, and FOCUS hard on the course material. I strongly recommend. P

I'm one of 12 people in extremely HARD final exam and get F. 2012 fall, this class had 8 quizs, 7 reading assignments and 3 tests. Before midterm, half class people drop away (total 35 people ). He never explained any your question and homework. Notes from online, lecture == nothing. Avoid this guy. Take Dr.DeMaio or Dr. Watson .

Westlund is a very difficult professor. His lectures are pointless because he writes down the notes you can print out from online word for word on the board and doesn't even give examples. He is in a bad mood all the time and his pass fail rate is 1:9. 12 people attended the final. And he was not leniant on bumping your grade up if you were close.

Dr. Westlund is extremely smart in his field but struggles to realize that many are not.  His tests are very different than the proofs in class.  He will help if you come to his office and work on how you come to your conclusions.  Overall if you want a good grade i would avoid his classes

Extremely difficult class.  I would not recommend this class for the summer section.  He is very clear and precise but the exams and quizzes are HARD.  Homework is only a small percentage of your grade.  Midterm and Final are the most important.  Midterm took most students all 3 hours to complete.

Dr. Westlund is very knowledgeable and explains the material better than most mathematics teachers ive come across. This class is very intense and a lot of work but he makes it manageable. Without the clarity of his lectures i would be so lost. Also he makes time for students and helps and any ways he can. Hes not there to make it harder on you.

Extremely Hard Class. Half the Class dropped. Avoid if you don't have good study ethics.You grades are Quizes, Homework, Midterm, Final. I studied at least 20 hours for Both Test did not do good in either. Test were unnecessarily hard. No amount of time would be a enough time to study for his test.

His midterm and final are harder than needed. Got an A on the midterm, took the final and had studied for 18 hours, getting all the material down, and got an embarassingly low grade, lowest test grade in college and I have gone up to calc III and other difficult math classes. You can hardly prepare for these tests with the material you are given.

The class is very work intensive and difficult. You will need to do your homework and study but Westlund tries his best to be free to help you with whatever. Is very open to questions because he knows that the material is hard. Overall a good teacher but difficult material.

Very knowledgeable about material and will help students greatly. However hw wasnt always consistent with current class teachings and didn't have a clue on how to do the first test. Half the class dropped. But got easier over time and this is his first year teaching the course so he's improving. Liked him as a person. Takehome exams and hw r brutal

Extremely difficult class but He is very clear in his lectures. And his tests are deceivingly tough, and the take-home test is all Proofs. It's A TOUGH CLASS and Prepares you for Real Analysis. Don't get into this class if your not prepared to work; it's College.
